_header: Mine only joy my lady and mistress
_description:
An epistle to his lady, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 56) — twelve 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

BLHar682.First Lines:
Myn only ioy my lady and maystresWhiche are the hope of all my
                    worldis wele…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…I trust to god to doon so and y mayThat y shall ben rewardid
                    wel therfore
